IX.iii.1.E.8.a
.
Purpose of the Income Reminder Letter
Batch letter processing is in place to generate
VA Form 20-8992
,
Computer Generated Letter
- Income Reminder Letter
(
Income Reminder Letter
) for parents, widows, and Veterans who do not receive Social Security Disability (SSD) income.
The
Income Reminder Letter
is released to pensioners and Parents’ Dependency and Indemnity Compensation (DIC) recipients who
are not receiving SSD, and
are a certain age:
Veterans who are 62 or 65 years old
spouses who are 60, 62 or 65 years old, or
parents who are 62 or 65 years old.
This letter serves as a reminder to pension and Parents' DIC recipients to report income who are of Social Security retirement age but SSD is not reported on their award.
However, if pension or Parents' DIC recipients have a private attorney as their power of attorney, an
Income Reminder Letter
will not generate.  An 800 Series Work Item is generated under the 882C claim label.  In this instance, the SOO must release an
Income Reminder Letter
manually.
